intro: Senecio telmateius, commonly known as the Telmateia groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts. Senecio telmateius is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions.
